I really wanted to teach myself how to lucid dream when I was younger, so I read a lot of articles about it. Unfortunately one of the articles mentioned that lucid dreaming increases the chance of sleep paralysis and that terrified me. That night I had my first and only lucid dream. I was standing in a white empty room and realized I was lucid dreaming. For a moment I was elated that I had done it. Then I remembered the sleep paralysis and freaked out and woke myself up. I never had another lucid dream again. But now I get sleep paralysis anyway cause of a medication I'm on so I'm considering trying to learn again.

Depends on where I'm located in the house while s/he is trying to break in. I'd definitely try and grab my cell phone and something that can be used as a weapon, then run if I had a big enough head start. I'd break my window, climb the fence, and get out of the neighborhood. Once I was in an area with a lot of people, s/he would be a lot less likely to try and hurt me. There's a McDonald's not too far from my house so I'd probably try to go there before calling 911.
If I didn't have that big of a head start then I'd hide. I'm small so i can fit into a lot of unusual places. Obviously they'd find me eventually but hope I'd have my phone and would be calling 911 while they looked.
And if they found me before the police came, the last resort would be to get out and fight. Again, I'm small, so the attacker would have a good chance of beating me, so I wouldn't focus on taking out the attacker, I'd focus on taking over their weapon or rendering them unable to use it effectively.

I'm not a professional, but I've worked in haunted houses before and these are the things I've done.
The three tactics I've used are jumpscares, staring, and being gross.
For jumpscares you'll need a scary costume obviously. The more shocking/gory, the better. Perfect your scream- if you're good you'll be able to terrify everyone, if not you're going to sound like you're in a comedy. Then pick a good hiding spot. Walk through the house and try not to pick an obvious spot where you'd expect someone to jump out of. Pick an unusual spot that people might not look twice at. Then, when groups of people start coming through, jump out and scream. Make sure you get your timing right. If you do it too early or late it won't make as big of an impression. After you jump out you can hide again or chase the people- just make sure you don't touch them.
For staring (this is my favorite), put on a more dramatic costume- still scary though, obviously. Last time I did a vampire with thick eyeliner and blood running down my face. Find a spot to stand or sit. As people walk by and look at you, make direct eye contact and follow them slowly with your eyes. Turn only your head as needed. Try not to blink and don't let anyone break eye contact. This won't make them scream, but the dread of what you might or might not do will definitely make them nervous. And occasionally if they don't seem to think you're real, a quick swipe at them can be even more terrifying than a jumpscare.
For being gross (I'm sure this has a better name)- this is an ongoing performance. Maybe you can crawl on your hands and knees as a possessed demon or lay flailing on a table as a torture victim. Your purpose is to horrify the viewers rather than outright scare them. It can be a physical performance and require stamina and more advanced acting skills. Think of yourself as a living piece of decor.
So yea that's what I've done. I'm sure there's more tactics but this is just from my experience. I hope I could help.

WRITING.TITLE: Questions About College And Living
WRITING.TEXT:
This is a three part question as I'm going to be done with my lower division work soon and need to start thinking about where to move on.
1. Is a BFA necessary or would I be alright with an AA degree? I'm trying to decide whether it would be a better option to get my AA and then start auditioning full time and continue my training through private lessons and master classes, or to stick it out an extra two years and earn my BFA.
2. Is California a good place to stay in to start my career? I don't feel established enough yet to move across the country.
3. Do you guys attend classes outside of college, and if so, which ones have helped you the most in furthering your career?
If you have any other advice I'd be happy to hear it. I'm honestly terrified getting ready to jump in.

That's true- I didn't think of the possibility of a woman outright admitting she lied. That's not fair for the man who was accused that they get away without repercussions.
All I'm saying is it's hard to prove someone is lying.

Yes a false accusation should be punished. That's despicable to do to the accused and makes actual victims lose credibility as well. However it would be very hard to prove something didn't happen and it wouldn't be good if they were locking up real rape victims who hadn't provided enough proof.
My marine bio teacher made a good analogy once talking about falsifiable claims. The claim "there are no mermaids in the ocean" can be falsified by finding a mermaid. But the claim "there are mermaids in the ocean" can never be falsified because you can only falsify that by proving there are no mermaids in the ocean, and you can't do that because there's always the possibility you just haven't found one yet.
Similarly the claim "s/he was not raped" can be falsified by finding proof of the rape. But "s/he was raped" can never be falsified because there's no way to prove nothing happened.

I find that when I'm having a flare, the more "raw" the vegetable the more it makes me sick. So during that time I eat either cooked, processed, or broken down veggies- for example grilling onions before eating them, tomato sauce instead of whole tomatoes, and drinking soups and smoothies instead of trying to eat them raw.
As for not liking them- there's no recipe that's gonna magically make you like vegetables. If there's a couple you like, start there. Try eating veggies you don't like in combination with other things. For example I learned to like pickles by putting them in my burgers. At first I thought they were horrible, then I found them tolerable enough to keep on, then I started enjoying the taste, now I like them.
If you really just don't like the taste of vegetables another way you can get a dose of vegetables is in a smoothie along with fruits. I blend my own so I know exactly what's going in and that there's no extra sugar or anything. Obviously it won't work for every vegetable but ik kale is a really common one. If you blend it with some pineapple and yogurt or whatever combo you like you won't even taste the kale- it just adds a sweetness and a slight difference in texture.
A recipe book I use for smoothies is the Big Book of Juices- it has over 300 recipes and you can look up smoothies by ingredient. If you get a small portable blender and get in the habit of grinding up a smoothie for breakfast each morning you're already on your way to getting more veggies (and fruits)

And it was so much easier than us dancing around each other. I never had to read into anything or worry that I was annoying him or anything cause if i was he'd just let me know.
Again not speaking for all women and not saying all men are like this. And I know some girls just want to hear what they want to hear. These are my experiences and what I like. Not trying to offend anyone here.

As a person who used to self harm I'd say this is manipulative behavior. I self harmed as a coping mechanism and I absolutely did not want people to know. I didn't threaten people with it and when I ended up doing it I was ashamed and tried to hide it. I was convinced no one would care if I was hurting myself or even if I killed myself so I didn't see a point in talking about it.
Now I'm just one person out of many, many self harmers so I'm not saying my experiences cover everyone's. But it sounds like your wife is trying to make you feel guilty rather than actually feeling like she needs to self harm.
About the breaking the skin thing, some self harmers don't do that so you can't really tell by that alone. Some people scratch, some people use tools that make it hard to break the skin, and some people love breaking the skin - it really depends on the person.
It sounds like your wife could still benefit from therapy as it sounds like she does have some issues- self harming issues might not be what she's dealing with exactly, it could be attention seeking or abandonment issues also.
And as a disclaimer in case this advice is completely wrong- I'm not a professional in any way so this is just my personal opinion. Good luck with whatever happens tho

The IV didn't hurt cause they numbed my hand beforehand. Then they knocked me out and I woke up after it was done. My throat hurt but other than that I wasn't in any pain. I was more confused that loopy, I just asked the same questions over and over which were "is it done already," "did it go ok," and "did I clean out good enough". You'd be more likely to say smtg stupid if you were drunk or high. Then they wheeled me out and I got jamba juice for my throat and then I slept for the rest of the day.
Tbh the worst part is the cleaning out before hand- after that everything is easy.

I live in California where weed is legal but when applying for a ride operator job we need to be clean anyways. Then every year we want to stay we get another test that we can't fail. They said they'd be giving us random tests throughout the year as well to make sure we stay clean but I haven't seen it happen yet.
They say they don't care what we do outside of work but ofc weed stays in the system for a long time so if you do end up getting a random test you're done. I mean on the one hand I get it, can't have a bunch of drugged up ride operators in the park. On the other it's hella annoying planning exactly when and how much I smoke in order to pass our annual test.

I don't know why people still mistake me as a guy because I have pink hair that goes to my chin and wear dangly earrings, but I get mistaken for a guy at work all the time. Could be because I have a lower voice for a girl and our uniforms make everyone look hella flat chested. Anyways I was talking to this dad who was asking me questions on how I operated the ride I was currently at and then I asked him to step back cause I was going to close the gates. He kinda saluted me and was like "yes sir," and I didn't correct him cause I didn't want to risk making a guest unhappy.
However I am able to make my voice really high when I want to (think retail voice/camp counselor voice) so I just started doing that. Suddenly he goes quiet and stops talking to me and I figure he got it. Then he gets on the ride and I check his seat belt and he makes a big point of going "Thank you *ma'am*". Honestly it was hilarious to me.

I already posted this story in answer to another question but it applies here too so ima say it again.
Basically I tried to kill myself and ended up in the psych ward, which I hated cause it was hella boring all we were supposed to do was sit around and think about getting better. We had half a deck of cards, a cloth puzzle in one piece, and a TV with all the shitty channels. So we were bored to tears most of the time and that wasn't making me feel better at all.
Night 3 I was in the community room after dinner and they played the Hunger Games movie for us which has always been my favorite movie and book. Anyways they reached the scene where Katniss was trapped in a tree by the careers and I was marvelling at her acting job.
That reminded me of my own passion for acting and how much I loved it and all the roles I'd dreamed of playing and the things I wanted to do. I mean it wasn't an instant cure but it slowly gave my life purpose again. After I got out of the psych ward I started acting again and then singing a little and now I'm in college to become a theatre major (slash waitress, I know). But I like to think that movie stopped me from ending it all.
I have a ton of nightmares now days where I'm dying slowly and all I do in those dreams is cry and talk about how I'll never perform again. I mean it sucks but at least I know I don't wanna die now.
So yea sorry for rambling so much but retelling the story helps me too sometimes lol
Also I just want to add that they stopped the movie halfway through and made us go to bed and I'm still pissed about that.
I always wondered what would happen if you shaved a maine coon- thank you for satisfying my curiosity. Your kitty is adorable btw especially the tail
Whenever someone says tattoos are gonna look bad when I get older ima show them this pic. She looks badass.

Happened to me too during my very first flare about a year ago. I lost a bunch of weight and I'm already really small so I looked unhealthy af.
So my doctor said I needed to drink three cans of Ensure a day which was fine in the beginning but after about a week I got sick of the taste. It didn't make me gain weight but it made me lose weight slower.
I also tried to make myself eat a little bit of solid food every day even though it was usually only a couple bites. Rice, mashed potatoes, plain popcorn, plain scrambled eggs, and applesauce were about the only four things I could tolerate.
Really my savior was jamba juice. That stuff is amazing. That's just a personal preference but I tell it to everyone.
Good luck getting through this flare- you got this :)

First of all I'd definitely recommend getting your hair done at a salon- it's 100% worth the extra money. I tried to dye my friend's hair but we ran out of dye and also I didn't leave the bleach in long enough so she ended up with half normal hair and half greenish brown hair. So salon all the way if you're not experienced.
They'll bleach your hair if they think it's too dark to take the color or if your hair is blonde enough they'll put it straight in.
Of course your natural hair is going to come back because you always have more hair growing in. The more of your hair you dye the longer it'll take- for example if you only do your tips you can cut them off if you get sick of it but if you do your whole head you're going to have to wait a while if you want to grow a whole new head of natural hair.
If you want to change your hair a whole new color permanently then I'd reccomend getting it touched up every few months- either when it fades too much or when your roots start showing too much- i.e, when your natural hair grows back and you feel like it's showing too much.
If you only want to do it one time, then just dye it once and either wait for it to grow out or wait till you get sick of it and dye it back.
If you want to do tons of different colors just go in to change it whenever you feel like it. That's what I do- every few months when my current color fades, I go back, pick a new color, and cut the dry ends off.
If you're worried you're gonna hate it I'd reccomend chalking your hair or using a temporary dye to see what it'll look like before fully committing. But if it turns out a complete disaster, you can always just dye it back.
There's not really much else to do for upkeep. If you want to preserve the color longer you're gonna have to take cold showers and stay out of the sun for long periods of time, and I'd reccomend washing your hair with a lot of conditioner specifically meant for dyed hair in order to keep it soft.
Good luck and let me know if you have any other questions :)
For my endoscopy they knocked me out and I woke up with a sore throat. Then I got jamba juice and went home and slept all day. It's really not bad at all. The sore throat is the worst part.

WRITING.TITLE: I'm Sick of People Saying They're Jealous of Me
WRITING.TEXT:
A surprising amount of people love to vent to me about how jealous they are of me. Everyone at my school, after finding out my PE class was waived, would respond with "luckyyyy" or "I wish I was you" or "you're so lucky to be sick, you have no idea how awful it was running the mile today"
That stings, especially cause I'd give anything to be able to take PE class.
I even have people tell me they wish they had broken legs like me so that people will feel sorry for them, or that they wish they could trade bodies with me so they can have my "robot legs" (KAFOs).
I know I shouldn't get mad and these ppl are just trying to be friendly. But I'd give anything to be healthy and be able to walk and run and jump and not be in pain as much as them and all they want is "robot legs" and for people to feel sorry for them.
Do any of you guys get these comments and if so how do you respond?

When I was really sick and couldn't keep any solid foods down I drank a lot of Jamba Juice and Ensure. It didn't help me gain weight but it prevented me from losing weight until I was good enough to eat.

Meeting my dad's side of the family in Vietnam. The meds I'm on make me so immunosupressed there's no way I'd be able to do any kind of international traveling, especially to rural Vietnam. Not to mention finding food and water that wouldn't make me have a flare (idk if I spelled that right sorry). It sucks cause I'm half Viet and I've always wanted to meet the rest of my family and see where my dad was born. But it's not something I'm gonna risk my life to do.

WRITING.TITLE: A Q A for the Helicopter Parents at my Workplace
WRITING.TEXT:
Dear Parents,
To save you the hassle of asking me these questions when you bring your kids to an amusement park, I've prepared a short Q A answering all of your burning questions! Feel free to share this with any parent who is considering bringing their child to an amusement park!
Note: I'm certified at a chairswing style ride but these answers apply to any ride you're wondering about :)
Q: Are you going to double check my kid?
A: Don't worry. We check everyone.
Q: But what about my kid? She's the one in the pink sweater!
A: I checked her. She's fine.
Q: But what if she's not?
A: She is.
Q: But what if she falls out?
A: She won't unless she decides to jump out.
Q: But the seatbelt looks wrong!
A: Come back and criticize me after you get certified at this ride :)
Q: What are you doing now??
A: Pressing the button that makes it start.
Q: What is it doing??
A: Starting.
Q: Now what is it doing??
A: Going up.
Q: Is it supposed to make that noise??
A: Yup.
Q: Why is your hand over the red button?
A: In case there's an emergency.
Q: There's gonna be an emergency???
A: I said IN CASE.
Q: Now what are you doing?
A: Watching the ride.
Q: Don't you think that's creepy?
A: You're right. I'll close my eyes and plug my ears instead.
Q: WHERE'S MY KID?? SAY HI TO THE CAMERA! DON'T JUMP OUT! IT'S OKAY! JUST STAY PUT. EVERYTHING IS GOING TO BE ALRIGHT.
A: Please stop screaming in my ear while I operate a piece of heavy machinery with your kid on it.
Q: What about that noise?
A: We're trained to bring the ride down at any sign of abnormality. Don't worry.
Q: Why is the ride coming down??
A: Because it's over...
Q: What if my kid jumps out?
A: It'll probably hurt.
Q: CAN YOU GO LET MY KID OUT?
A: I'm not allowed to leave the control pannel... but you can go let your own kid out!
Don't get me wrong, I love my job! But don't worry parents- your kids are more safe on the ride than I am in the control booth. Relax and stop screaming in my ear :)
Drew a dick on her sweater. In their defense she was a dick. I still felt bad for her though.

Well my mom spent all year talking about how great she felt after going off a antidepressants and what horrible side effects they gave her.
Then I get prescribed antidepressants and suddenly she's on my ass every day making me take them and forcing me to go to my therapy group even though they made me tired as fuck.
I mean I'm not mad at her, they did make me feel better and I know she was just concerned for me. Still hypocritical.

I mentioned my birthday in passing to a classmate and the the day of she made me three adorable cards and a drawing of me. I still have them in my drawer. Not even my close friends remember my birthday so that was a huge deal to me

Idk if you're familiar with the EduHam program but my school had the opportunity to participate in it. We had to write a project about one of the historical figures in Hamilton's time and then we'd get a ticket to go.
My project was actually chosen to perform on the Hamilton stage which was cool cause I got to see backstage and meet some of the actors and then perform which was a dream come true for me. The performers got orchestra seating as well which I never would've been able to afford but the view was great. And as a bonus after there was an ice cream truck and I happened to have two bucks. So yea that was the best trip I've been on.
As a side note this wasn't Broadway it was the Orpheum Theatre in San Fransisco. The performance wasn't any less impressive (I'm talking about the Hamilton one not mine lol) just specifying where I'm at.

Did you use semi permanent dye or something more temporary? If it's permanent or semi permanent it's going to be there for awhile. The only way to really make it go away would be lighten it with bleach or totally bleach and redo it, but you'd want to be careful with overdoing the bleach and damaging your hair.
You could also try to fade it by taking hot showers and spending a lot of time out in the sun, which you're supposed to avoid if you want to preserve the color.

I inhaled my ball the other day. If you blow your nose really hard it might come back. If not I don't think there's anywhere it could really go. If you ate it, there's nothing really you can do about it. I'd reccomend keeping a few extra septum rings on hand for situations like these.

She's mad at me for a small mistake I made two months ago and is spreading rumors about me that not only everyone I work with has heard but all of the other areas of my workplace have heard as well. She turned a lot of people against me and it's really awkward during break and lunch now. Not only is she spreading rumors about me, she complains about me to my coworkers- my appearance, personality, habits, everything. Whenever I do something she doesn't like, even if it's not against the rules, she yells at me and then goes to the guest and tells them everything I said was wrong, thus making them mad at me and usually getting me cussed out. But when the manager is around she's the nicest person ever.
I really don't even care if she has a bone to pick with me, but I lost a lot of friends at work and that really hurts.

I'm an introvert and I'm not afraid to talk to people or anything, sometimes I just need someone else to initiate a conversation. And I do get tired of socializing after awhile and it's annoying when people take it personal. That's pretty much it. If I really want to get to know someone better then I'll reach out myself.
Well now I know what to make for my uncle's birthday
Can't wait. I have the pop art version which is my favorite right now but I'm super stoked for the new content and just to have the 10th anniversary edition in my collection.

My piercer definitely got my sweet spot (she showed me where it was and let me feel it before she pierced it) and it was still my most painful piercing. I think it's different for everyone but I'm surprised how many people didn't feel any pain.
I've never thought about it that way- that's a really good point.
I've heard that before... not very reassuring...

I tried it for years and it didn't help me at all. I literally can't build muscle and I was dislocating my ankles and knees every day. I'd reccomend asking a doctor familiar with EDS before trying.
And I'm just gonna put a disclaimer down here: I'm not a doctor myself. If my advice ruins your life... well I warned you lol

Oof you have my deepest sympathies. I definitely got the anxiety with the Prednisone- I had random panic attacks out of nowhere for months. It also caused me to gain about 20 pounds (I think it was water cause I lost it right after I went off.) And I was either always sleeping or wide awake.
The worst thing it did for me was magnify my depression and just send me spiraling down- I had a bit of mild depression at the time and the prednisone just enhanced it.
The way I dealt with it is not a method I'd reccomend- I decided I was going to kill myself, my mom found out, and I ended up in the psych ward.
As soon as I got out my doctor took me off and put me on Mercaptopurine instead.
So what I'd reccomend is don't do what I did, if your anxiety gets too bad or if you feel the urge to hurt yourself, tell your doctor you need to get off immediately, and having a therapist to help you get through this time isn't a bad idea either.
Otherwise what I did was try and go to events and do hobbies that interested me- which was hard when I was feeling depressed but I tried to do something that excited me each day.
Good luck-- you can get through this :)
I get most of my doll furniture and accessories on Etsy. 1:8 isn't a super common scale but I see it around, and a lot of shops take custom orders as well.

The Giver. The main characters were supposed to be like twelve and they made them teenagers having a dumb forbidden romance... as if there wasn't enough of that.
Also I'm a diehard Hunger Games fan so of course I noticed every dialogue and detail change and would love nothing more than an 8 hour R rated version detailing each and every line of dialogue and death and everything. But of course that would be expensive and probably really unpopular.

Usually I walk all the way to the back looking for empty seats cause I hate sitting next to people. Then if there's no empty seats I panic and sit next to the smallest person I see to reduce the chance of touching them.
By small person I mean small adult obviously.

For me, I get into a totally different mindset when I walk onstage for an audition. I think to myself, "I look great, I'm doing great, and everyone wants to see me." Then if we have time to practice or they give us space I'll go to the middle and do my thing. Not trying to butt other people out or be pushy- just to be unapologetically there and put the entirety of my effort into my dancing/acting/whatever without a care about what other people think. For an audition, it's essential to stop worrying about what other people are thinking about you or it WILL hold you back.
And in real life I'm a pretty reserved person, so I just treat my audition self as another character- "this is Audition Emma and she knows she looks sexy doing this dance and she's going to stand right here and practice".
You don't have to stay in that character mindset after you get the part. You don't even need to do what I do. I'm not a professional, just a fellow actor sharing my own method.
Basically just forget about everyone else and do your thing.

WRITING.TITLE: I feel heartless for not wanting kids
WRITING.TEXT:
Stupid rant but I can't really post this anywhere else without being patronized- I mean maybe I'll get patronized here too I'll find out.
So I'm only sixteen and work with people ages 15-20, so I was surprised with how much kids were brought up in our conversations when I first started my job. Literally all of the girls and even a couple of the guys are suffering with baby fever.
Recently one of my coworkers found out he's gonna be a dad and when his friend was telling me about it I was expressing my condolences and saying maybe if he was lucky the baby wouldn't be his. She was shocked and told me he was elated.
This was news to me- he's still in high school and elated to be a father?
A few days later I mentioned it to one of my other co-workers- something like "all the babies that come here are adorable but honestly I don't understand how a parent could love a child so much when all it does is bring pain and exhaustion."
She actually yelled at me, calling me selfish for not wanting kids and said we were born to raise kids and she couldn't believe how selfish I was being by not wanting to bring life into the world. She said she couldn't wait to have kids and she already felt love for her future children and couldn't believe I couldn't.
Now I feel confused- like I was born lacking a certain empathy or feeling I need to love a child or whatever. But I do know how to feel love because I care about other people a lot. I just don't think I could ever love a child if I got pregnant.
So yeah. I don't know how to conclude this post. Thanks for reading my whole rant I guess if you actually did.

There was a guy in high school who said he liked girls under five feet so he could pretend they were little children. He wasn't joking either. Then he started hitting on me... hahaha no thanks.
I'm gonna assume this isn't the case for most men tho.

WRITING.TITLE: Questions About Buying New Jewelry?
WRITING.TEXT:
I've had my nipples pierced for almost a year now so I'm very excited to change them. However I'm having a hard time finding implant grade titanium pieces. So I guess my question has two parts.
1. Is there a place online that sells titanium nipple jewelry? Most of the stores I've been to have had very sparse selections.
2. There are piercing shops near my house I could go to, but are you allowed to just walk into one and buy jewelry? And if so would I need an ID to do that?

Well obviously wear the bandages and clean the piercing three times a day with either piercing spray or salt water. Other than that all you can really do is make sure it doesn't get bumped or irritated too much.
Some ways to tell if a piercing is rejecting or migrating is if the hole seems bigger, you start to see the bar through your skin, or it seems irritated all the time. In that case you should see your piercer and have it removed before it tears through the skin.
I don't mean to alarm you with that tho. You'll see the bar pushing the skin long before that happens. Congrats on your new piercing!

Looks nice :)
Have you ever considered the same piece but in gold? I think that would look really good on you.
Beautiful. I'd never have the patience to spend that long on a painting but kudos to you for doing so. I love how clean you were able to make the lines- I was never able to figure that out.
My grandma used to make rose hip tea when I was a little kid and I became fascinated and made all my friends eat rose petals. Totally forgot about it until now though... thanks for reminding me!

I'm glad it's finally happening... too bad it's taken so long. The more diversity we get with actors, producers, basically everyone, the more new ideas and different takes on characters we get... basically what I'm trying to say is that if everyone is the same it's gonna get boring.

Definitely go in with a monologue prepared from the style of the show- but not a monologue from the actual show. What happens after largely depends on the director. Sometimes they'll have you just go. The last audition I was at the director kept me and had me read a monologue from the show (with script) and then had me cold read two scenes with other actors. So basically go in with a monologue ready but be prepared for anything.
Make sure you understand the play too. Reading the whole thing before the audition is a good idea. My high school drama teacher was a former director and told me that when she cast shakespeare plays she always had the actors cold read a monologue or scene and then made her casting decisions based on who was actually able to understand and portray the language.

I started out with Romeo and Juliet, but that's just because they made us watch it in school. The first one I read on my own was The Tempest- it was funny, fast moving, and easy to understand, and afterwards I went on Sparknotes to decode the jokes I didn't get the first time. It was a lot of fun and I ended up using one of the monologues as an audition piece later on.

"Is that a banana in your pants or are you just happy to see me?"
"Nah, it's literally a banana in my pants. Sorry."

I actually have both of the same problems you do and was able to get my nipples pierced just fine and love them so much.
The key here is finding a great piercer. Make sure he or she is certified, sterile, and, of course, makes you feel comfortable.
My piercer had three sizes of nipple bar and when I told her that my nipples were really small, she just pierced them with a small bar. If your nipples really are too small, though, a good piercer will tell you that- they won't do a piercing that you aren't anatomically suited for.
As for the second part of your question- I'm also immunocompromised with sensitive skin and my piercings were able to heal fine. I know I said this already but find a good piercer who will do it correctly. For the initial jewelry I'd reccomend titanium in order to prevent an allergic reaction.
Then it's up to you to take care of them. They are high maintenance piercings. You need to clean them three times a day with piercing spray or warm saltwater. And at least for the first few months make sure you change your bra or shirt every day to avoid buildup of bacteria. And make sure you don't bump or pull at your chest as that will irritate them.
As for how much it'll hurt- I mean obviously it's gonna hurt some but I honestly didn't find it very bad at all. I thought my septum was worse. My piercer iced my nipples first to make them hard and I think that numbed them up a bit. Then I got really nervous and she played some music and I just focused on that and then it was just like a hard pinch.
About thirty minutes after my nipples started burning really bad so I took off my shirt and iced them but that also went away after about an hour. And it was smooth sailing from there.
Let me know if you have any other questions- as you can see from my essay, I love talking about my piercings.
